course.title: Hominid Paleontology and Evolution
course.meeting_text: Tu., Th., 10–11:30 and a weekly section
course.faculty_text: David Pilbeam and John C. Barry
course.description: A lecture, discussion, and research course using cast and comparative collections, focusing on important issues in hominid paleobiology: ape ancestors, human ancestors, and early hominin radiations; earliest Homo; neandertals and modern humans; the role of environmental change. Can be taken as a research seminar.
course.prerequisites: Life Sciences 2 or Science of Living Systems 16 or Human Evolutionary Biology 1420 or with permission of instructor.
